title: ICE: `[u8; 18446744073709551615]` is too big for the current architecture

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I tried this code: ```rust enum Bug { V([u8; !0]), } ``` I expected to see this happen: Complain that the array size is too large Instead, this happened: It crashed the compiler ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` stable 1.41.0 (5e1a79984 2020-01-27) beta 1.42.0-beta.4 (13e0fbc20 2020-02-24) nightly 1.43.0-nightly (6fd8798f4 2020-02-25) ``` A quick look at Godbolt suggests this has been happening from `1.12` onwards.
